TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit MetadataExchangeClient extends System.Object

Docs.summary: Downloads service metadata.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient> to download metadata. Typically, a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient> is configured for a metadata request and then passed to the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataResolver.Resolve%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataResolver.Resolve%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> method for the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataResolver> to use to download metadata.
However, you can use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient> directly to retrieve metadata as a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSet> that contains <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSection> objects.
Whether used directly or passed to a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataResolver>, <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient> has the following members to control the metadata download process:
- Use the constructors to customize the binding to use when making the metadata request.
- Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient.HttpCredentials%2A> property to specify the credentials used to make an HTTP/GET request.
- Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient.SoapCredentials%2A> property to specify the credentials used to make a WS-Transfer metadata request.
- Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient.MaximumResolvedReferences%2A> property to limit the number of metadata references the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient> resolves.
- Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient.OperationTimeout%2A> property to limit the time spent retrieving metadata.
- Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient.ResolveMetadataReferences%2A> property to specify whether to locate and retrieve other metadata documents referred to by the metadata downloaded from the original metadata endpoint.
- Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient.GetMetadata%2A> methods to begin the downloading process.
In addition, you can create a derived class that can override the following two protected methods:
- Override the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient.GetChannelFactory%2A> method to modify the channel that makes a metadata request using WS-Transfer.
- Override the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient.GetWebRequest%2A> method to modify the <xref:System.Net.HttpWebRequest> that makes a metadata request using HTTP/GET.
## Examples The following code example shows the use of <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient> to specify a download binding, resolve any contained references to metadata, and download the metadata.
[!code-csharp[MetadataResolver#3](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/metadataresolver/cs/client.cs#3)]

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following table lists the default bindings that are used for various protocol schemes.
|Scheme|Binding| |------------|-------------| |http|<xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding> (<xref:System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode.None?displayProperty=nameWithType>)| |https|<xref:System.ServiceModel.WSHttpBinding> (<xref:System.ServiceModel.SecurityMode.Transport?displayProperty=nameWithType>)| |net.tcp|<xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CustomBinding> with a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.TcpTransportBindingElement>| |net.pipe|<xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.CustomBinding> with a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Channels.NamedPipeTransportBindingElement>|

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient.GetWebRequest%2A> method is called:
- When there is an attempt to resolve a <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataLocation?displayProperty=nameWithType>.
- When <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClientMode.HttpGet?displayProperty=nameWithType> is used.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the credentials used to make an HTTP/GET request.
Docs.value: The object used to establish the request credentials.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient.HttpCredentials%2A> property to customize the security credentials that the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient> uses when requesting metadata using HTTP/GET.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property int MaximumResolvedReferences { int get(); void set(int value); };
member this.MaximumResolvedReferences : int with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of references to metadata that the downloads.
Docs.value: The number of metadata references the resolves. The default is 10.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient.MaximumResolvedReferences%2A> property to limit the resources accessed by metadata that contains a large number of references. This limit applies to any reference in the metadata that results in a subsequent request, including metadata references, metadata locations, WSDL imports, and XML Schema imports and includes.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property TimeSpan OperationTimeout { TimeSpan get(); void set(TimeSpan value); };
member this.OperationTimeout : TimeSpan with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the period of time within which the metadata must be downloaded before an exception is thrown.
Docs.value: The period within which the metadata must be downloaded; the default is 1 minute.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient.OperationTimeout%2A> property to limit the amount of time the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient> takes before ending the operation.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property bool ResolveMetadataReferences { bool get(); void set(bool value); };
member this.ResolveMetadataReferences : bool with get, set

Attribute.AttributeName: get: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")
set: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a value that controls whether references to metadata are resolved.
Docs.value: if references to metadata are resolved; otherwise, . The default is .

remarks.format: ## Remarks Set the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient.ResolveMetadataReferences%2A> property to `false` to prevent the resolution of references to metadata. In this case, references are returned as <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataReference?displayProperty=nameWithType> or <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataLocation?displayProperty=nameWithType> objects inside the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataSet?displayProperty=nameWithType>.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::ServiceModel::Description::ClientCredentials ^ SoapCredentials { System::ServiceModel::Description::ClientCredentials ^ get(); void set(System::ServiceModel::Description::ClientCredentials ^ value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the client security credentials used to make a WS-Transfer metadata request.
Docs.value: The client security credentials used to make a WS-Transfer metadata request.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient.SoapCredentials%2A> property to specify the security credentials the <xref:System.ServiceModel.Description.MetadataExchangeClient> uses when making a WS-Transfer metadata request.
